intro: Pichisermollia stewartii, commonly known as the Stewart's pichisermollia, is a rare and lesser-known plant species belonging to the family Apiaceae. It is characterized by its finely divided, fern-like leaves and small, clustered white flowers that bloom in late spring. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments, such as woodland floors or along stream banks. Its unique morphology and restricted habitat make it an important subject for botanical research. Due to its limited distribution, conservation efforts are crucial to its survival.
